title: Reference Material Utilization Project for Strengthening Mathematical Information Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and proficiency in fundamental smartphone usage
context.additional_context: Mobile-Centric Math Information Literacy Program: Project-Based Problem Solving Using Print/Digital Resources in Low-Tech Smartphone Environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify and utilize at least three credible reference materials (print/digital) for solving mathematics-related information problems.
Learners can understand the importance of "exploratory research" in the information-seeking process and design a preliminary investigation phase using reference materials before finalizing a topic.

Learners can assess the credibility of mathematical information by applying three core concepts of the ACRL Framework: authority is constructed and contextual, information has value, and scholarship as conversation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
